pkgmetadata.longdescription: The /Labeled IO/ (LIO) library provides information flow control for incorporating untrusted code within Haskell applications. Most code should import module "LIO" and whichever label type the application is using (e.g., "LIO.DCLabel"). The core functionality of the library is documented in "LIO.TCB". LIO was implemented by David Mazieres (<http://www.scs.stanford.edu/~dm/>), Deian Stefan (<http://www.scs.stanford.edu/~deian/>), Alejandro Russo (<http://www.cse.chalmers.se/~russo/>) and John C. Mitchell (<http://www.stanford.edu/~jcm/>). The extended version of our paper, that includes the proofs is available here: <http://www.scs.stanford.edu/~deian/pubs/stefan:2011:flexible-ext.pdf>. The library depends on the @DCLabel@ module. You can read more on DC Labels here: <http://www.scs.stanford.edu/~deian/dclabels/>.
